questionsList.question: What does this CSS do and why is it useful in responsive design? * {box-sizing: border-box;}
questionsList.answer: It includes the padding and border in width and height of all elements.  If we set a width on an element, for instance 25%, we can add border or padding while ensuring it remains constant at 25%.

questionsList.question: What is the basic idea behind CSS? (one sentence)
questionsList.answer: In CSS you can use a selector to target an HTML element in the DOM (Document Object Model) and then apply a variety of attributes to that element to change the way it is displayed on the page.

questionsList.question: What are the three components of a hexadecimal color?  What is the lowest hexadecimal value and what color does it represent?
questionsList.answer: A hexadecimal color has three components - red, green, and blue.  Two hexadecimal digits represent each component from 00 - FF.  #000000 is the lowest value and represents black.

questionsList.question: Explain CSS variable cascading and why it is useful.
questionsList.answer: In CSS a variable is available for use in any elements nested within the element it was created in.  This effect is known as cascading.  CSS variables are often created in the :root element so they are available throughout the page.

questionsList.question: Explain the difference between a browser fallback and a variable fallback.
questionsList.answer: You can attach fallback values to CSS variables that they revert to if the initial value is invalid.  For instance: {background-color: var(--background-color, black)}.  When a browser parses your CSS it ignores any properties it does not support.  IE does not support variables.  A browser fallback is providing a more supported value immediately before your declaration, {background-color: black}, so the browser can fall back on it.

questionsList.question: Explain the difference between margin and padding
questionsList.answer: Padding is the distance between an element's content and its border.  Margin is the distance between an element's border and other content.

questionsList.question: Explain the float property
questionsList.answer: Floating elements are removed from the normal flow of a document. They are pushed to the left or right of their parent element.

questionsList.question: What does {font-size: 2em} mean?
questionsList.answer: em are relative size units.  If the default size on the page is 12px then 2em corresponds to 24px.

questionsList.question: What is a psuedo-class?
questionsList.answer: A psuedo-class is a specific keyword that can be added to a selector in order to select a specific state of an element.  For example we can apply the hover psuedo-class to change the CSS rules when the mouse hovers over an element.
